subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The World Jesus Was Born Into
description: A short lesson to help you apply The World Jesus Was Born Into.

hook.text: Roman soldiers, Jewish priests, Greek philosophers. The world Jesus entered was a pressure cooker of cultures.

buildup.text: Judea was a Roman colony. Jews resented Roman rule and expected a messiah to liberate them militarily.

discovery.text: Greek philosophy, Roman roads, and Jewish monotheism created the perfect conditions for a new religion to spread.

twist.text: Jesus wasn't the military messiah people expected. His kingdom was 'not of this world.' Most Jews were confused.

climax.text: Christianity succeeded partly because Rome built the infrastructure. Roads, language, and law carried the gospel.

punchline.text: Rome built the roads. Christianity used them. Empire became the vehicle.

quiz.question: How did the Roman Empire help Christianity spread?
options: Roads, common language, and infrastructure carried the message
